thread.title: Garrett heads SI.com Midseason All-America Team
thread.title_full: Garrett heads SI.com Midseason All-America Team

title: Garrett heads SI.com Midseason All-America Team
text:
Garrett heads SI.com Midseason All-America Team Posted: Updated: 
Texas A&M sophomore defensive end Myles Garrett headed a three-player Aggie contingent on the Midseason All-America Team compiled by Sports Illustrated. 
Garrett, who leads the Southeastern Conference in sacks, tackles for loss and forced fumbles, was a first-team selection, while senior punter Drew Kaser and true freshman wide receiver/return specialist Christian Kirk were on the second team. 
Of Garrett, the SI.com staff described him as a “freakish athlete who makes getting pressure on QBs look easy by flying around offensive linemen.” Garrett, from Arlington, Texas, has filled the stat sheet with 30 tackles, 8.5 sacks and 11.5 tackles for loss, seven QB hurries, three forced fumbles, two batted down passes and a blocked punt. Among FBS defenders, Garrett ranks No. 3 in QB sacks and is tied for No. 7 in TFLs and No. 5 in forced fumbles. 
Kaser, from Strongsville, Ohio, leads the SEC and ranks No. 2 in the FBS with a 49.5 punt average, which is on pace to break his own school record by nearly two yards. In addition, Kaser has placed eight of his 24 boots inside the opponent’s 20-yard line and boomed 12 50-yard plus punts. Kaser is on pace to break the career punt average record at Texas A&M and the SEC. 
Kirk, from Scottsdale, Ariz., leads the nation with a 25.1 punt return average (on 11 returns) and is tied for the FBS lead with two punt return touchdowns. He leads the SEC in receiving yards per game with 101.5. He leads all SEC freshmen in scoring, touchdowns, receptions, receiving yards, punt return average and all-purpose yards.
